items.notes: Trade deal will make whisky, gin, automobiles, medical devices cheaper. 99% of UK products get tariff elimination. Social security exemption saves 20% of salaries for Indian workers.
Trump executive order to promote domestic drug manufacturing. FDA directed to expedite approval process for new domestic pharmaceutical plants.
Net profit rose 3.3% YoY to ₹5,048 crore. NIM contracted 40 bps due to elevated deposit costs. Treasury income doubled to ₹1,559 crore.
Number of PEs in India increased 60-65% between 2016-2024. Buyouts share rose from 37% in 2022 to 51% in 2024. 83% of deals over 5 years old expected for exits in 2025.
Consolidated loss of ₹545 crore vs ₹550 crore YoY. One-time ESOP expense of ₹492 crore. MTUs dropped 25% YoY. UPI incentives down to ₹70 crore from ₹288 crore.
Shareholders approved plan to split automaker into two listed companies, separating passenger and commercial vehicle arms including JLR brand.
Secured 1,500 MW thermal contract with UP at ₹5.383/unit for 25 years. Fixed charge ₹3.727/unit, fuel charge ₹1.656/unit.
BSE profit jumped 5x to ₹494 crore. NSE profit at ₹2,650 crore, down 31% sequentially. Revenue growth driven by transaction charges.
Bilateral trade projected to reach $120B by 2030. Whisky tariffs reduced from 150% to 75%, eventually to 40%. Social security exemption benefits 60,000+ IT employees.
MUFG in advanced talks to buy minority stake in HDB Financial Services for ₹12,000 crore. Seeking up to 19% stake. HDB valuation declined to $8-8.5B from $10-12B.
Uber agreed to buy 85% of Turkish delivery platform for $700M. Trendyol delivered 200M+ orders in 2024, generating $2B gross bookings.
Net profit up 3.3% to ₹5,048 crore in Q4. NIM contracted to 3.02% from 3.18% YoY. Cost of deposits peaked in March quarter but moderating since.
Consolidated profit of ₹2,650 crore, down 31% sequentially. Revenue declined 13.3% to ₹3,771 crore due to reduced volumes in cash and derivatives.
Net profit soared 125.8% to ₹493.7 crore in Q4. Revenue rose 10.2% to ₹846.6 crore. Profit up 362% YoY, revenue jumped 75% YoY.
Oil climbed 4% on higher demand in Europe/China and Middle East tensions. Brent rose to $62.60, WTI gained to $59.55.
TPG acquired 35% stake from SII. Total investment from TPG and Novo Holdings amounts to $300M. SCHOTT retains 50%, SII holds minority stake.

consolidated.title: India-UK FTA
key_points: Trade deal will make whisky, gin, automobiles, medical devices cheaper. 99% of UK products get tariff elimination. Social security exemption saves 20% of salaries for Indian workers.
Bilateral trade projected to reach $120B by 2030. Whisky tariffs reduced from 150% to 75%, eventually to 40%. Social security exemption benefits 60,000+ IT employees.

consolidated.title: Bank of Baroda Results
key_points: Net profit rose 3.3% YoY to ₹5,048 crore. NIM contracted 40 bps due to elevated deposit costs. Treasury income doubled to ₹1,559 crore.
Net profit up 3.3% to ₹5,048 crore in Q4. NIM contracted to 3.02% from 3.18% YoY. Cost of deposits peaked in March quarter but moderating since.

consolidated.title: Stock Exchange Results
key_points: BSE profit jumped 5x to ₹494 crore. NSE profit at ₹2,650 crore, down 31% sequentially. Revenue growth driven by transaction charges.
Consolidated profit of ₹2,650 crore, down 31% sequentially. Revenue declined 13.3% to ₹3,771 crore due to reduced volumes in cash and derivatives.
Net profit soared 125.8% to ₹493.7 crore in Q4. Revenue rose 10.2% to ₹846.6 crore. Profit up 362% YoY, revenue jumped 75% YoY.

consolidated.title: US Pharma Domestic Push
key_points: Trump executive order to promote domestic drug manufacturing. FDA directed to expedite approval process for new domestic pharmaceutical plants.

consolidated.title: PE/VC Landscape Intensification
key_points: Number of PEs in India increased 60-65% between 2016-2024. Buyouts share rose from 37% in 2022 to 51% in 2024. 83% of deals over 5 years old expected for exits in 2025.

consolidated.title: Paytm Q4 Loss
key_points: Consolidated loss of ₹545 crore vs ₹550 crore YoY. One-time ESOP expense of ₹492 crore. MTUs dropped 25% YoY. UPI incentives down to ₹70 crore from ₹288 crore.

consolidated.title: Tata Motors Split Approved
key_points: Shareholders approved plan to split automaker into two listed companies, separating passenger and commercial vehicle arms including JLR brand.

consolidated.title: Adani Power Thermal Deal
key_points: Secured 1,500 MW thermal contract with UP at ₹5.383/unit for 25 years. Fixed charge ₹3.727/unit, fuel charge ₹1.656/unit.

consolidated.title: MUFG-HDFC Bank Deal
key_points: MUFG in advanced talks to buy minority stake in HDB Financial Services for ₹12,000 crore. Seeking up to 19% stake. HDB valuation declined to $8-8.5B from $10-12B.

consolidated.title: Uber-Trendyol Acquisition
key_points: Uber agreed to buy 85% of Turkish delivery platform for $700M. Trendyol delivered 200M+ orders in 2024, generating $2B gross bookings.

consolidated.title: Oil Prices Surge
key_points: Oil climbed 4% on higher demand in Europe/China and Middle East tensions. Brent rose to $62.60, WTI gained to $59.55.

consolidated.title: TPG-SCHOTT Poonawalla Deal
key_points: TPG acquired 35% stake from SII. Total investment from TPG and Novo Holdings amounts to $300M. SCHOTT retains 50%, SII holds minority stake.
